metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1228 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The RenderCounter::updateCounter function in core/rendering/RenderCounter.cpp in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76, does not force a relayout operation and consequently does not initialize memory for a data structure, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) token sequence.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-browser-l10n - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-chromedriver - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
oxideqmlscene - 1.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
oxideqt-codecs - 1.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required
